description:
OVAs bundled with special editions volumes of the manga.

1. Youkoso Fairy Hills!
Lucy comes across a mysterious written request. The client is looking for an object that is in Fairy Tail's female dormitory, Fairy Hills. To verify the request, Lucy visits Fairy Hills, and discovers that the client is Hilda, the dormitory head who is looking for a "shining treasure." Meanwhile, Natsu and the other guild members are cleaning their pool.

2. Yousei Gakuen: Yankee-kun to Yankee-chan
The anime adaptation of the manga side story "Yousei Gakuen Yankee-kun to Yankee-chan," which puts the characters of Fairy Tail in a school setting. The title is a parody of Miki Yoshikawa's "Yankee-kun to Megane-chan."

3. Memory Days
An all-new original story storyboarded by Hiro Mashima, the author of Fairy Tail, released on February 17, 2012. "Natsu's Secret" is going to be revealed in the "Past World"?! Guided by a "magic book" that's lying in the Guild's storage room, Natsu, Lucy, Happy, Gray, and Erza have traveled back into the past!!

4. Yousei-tachi no Gasshuku
Natsu, Lucy, and the others go to a training camp for the Grand Magic Games. While there, the Fairy Tail Guild take a much needed break at the beach and hot spring.

5. Dokidoki Ryuuzetsu Land
Adapting the chapter 298. The story is set during the Grand Magic Games when various guilds gather at the pool for some fun (and the chaos that ensues).

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Swimming
tags.description: Centers around the sport of swimming.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/hirano--aya/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hysteric_barbie) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/a_ya.hirano/) | [Website](http://ayahirano.jp/)

Aya Hirano is a Japanese actress, voice actress, and singer. Beginning in the entertainment industry as a child actor performing in television commercials, she played her first voice acting role in 2001 in the anime television series [Angel Tales](https://anilist.co/anime/682/). She released her first single "Breakthrough" in 2006, and her first album Riot Girl in 2008. She was formerly contracted to Space Craft Produce, a branch of the Space Craft Group, before moving to the talent agency Grick in August 2011. Her label was Lantis until 2011, when she moved to Universal Sigma. On September 1st, 2022, she announced that she was becoming a freelancer. 

Hirano is widely known for her roles as [Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/character/251/) in the [Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/anime/849/) franchise, [Konata Izumi](https://anilist.co/character/2169/) in [Lucky Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1887/), [Misa Amane](https://anilist.co/character/835/) in [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/) and [Lucy Heartfilia](https://anilist.co/character/5186/) in [Fairy Tail](https://anilist.co/anime/6702/).

In 2011, she temporarily ceased accepting new roles to recover from a pituitary gland tumor that had been affecting her health. She resumed voice acting activities later that year. In 2016, after appearing at a stage play in Tokyo, she went to New York to study abroad for four months.

__Awards:__
- Best Voice Actor at the Tokyo Anime Awards in 2007 for her role as Haruhi Suzumiya.
- Best Rookie Actress at the 1st Seiyuu Awards in 2007 for her role as Haruhi Suzumiya.
- Best Lead Actress at the 2nd Seiyuu Awards in 2008 for her roles as Konata Izumi, Misa Amane and [Layla Serizawa](https://anilist.co/character/2089/)

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Profile](https://haikyo.co.jp/profile/profile.php?ActorID=11570) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/readingradio)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Harran - Goddess of Victory - Nikke (VG)
- Ningguang - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Mikasa - Azur Lane (VG)

[Profile](http://zynchro.jp/talent/kakihara.html) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/charisma.tetsuya.days/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/tetsuya-kakihara/)

Commonly referred to as Kakkii by fans, Kakihara is a voice actor and a singer. As the latter, he is a member of Kiramune (music label) and represents the color of green. He was inspired to become a voice actor by [Yuuji Ueda](https://anilist.co/staff/95058/Yuuji-Ueda)'s performance in the Tokimeki Memorial dating sim game, and moved from Germany to Japan at age 18 to pursue his dream.

Kakihara speaks Japanese, English and German.

**Non-anime roles:**
- Wanderer - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Lloyd Bannings - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)
-Asaba Harumasa - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

__Height:__ 175 cm

[Profile](https://intention-k.com/profile/yuichi_nakamura) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nakamuraFF11) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCReBAqqC-hc9d70gOftfitg) | [Personal YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3eYAvjCVwNHgkaGbXX3sig)

**Trivia:**
- His nickname "Yuu-kyan" was given by Kenichi Suzumura.
- Very close with Tomokazu Sugita. They host a video game variety show called Tokyo Encounter together.
- Loves cats but is afraid of having them die before him, so doesn't have any of his own.
- Allergic to metals and alcohol; drinks non-alcoholic soft drinks or orange juice at parties.
- Colorblind.

__Non-Anime Roles:__

- Louis Guiabern - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiro_mashima)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQLYbIvGWtClestisnB1_6A)__

Japanese manga artist most known for his manga Groove Adventure Rave, published by Kodansha's Weekly Shonen Magazine, from 1999 to 2005. The series was later adapted into an anime. However, the anime adaption was cancelled before it could complete the series.

In 2003, he collected some of his one-shot titles in two volumes: Mashima-en- Vol.1 & 2. Those stories include, among others, Cocona, "Xmas Hearts" and "Fairy Tail", a sort of prototype for his last work.

In 2006, he began his now finished series, Fairy Tail, serialized in Kodansha's Weekly Shonen Magazine. He also published the manga Monster Hunter Orage.

Hiro Mashima was a notable guest at the 2008 San Diego Comic-Con. He has one daughter.

His artwork and [Oda Eiichiro](https://anilist.co/staff/96881/EiichiroOda)'s are greatly similar, but that is due to both of them being influenced largely by [Toriyama Akira](https://anilist.co/staff/96901/AkiraToriyama)'s work growing up.

His former assistant was [Yoshikawa Miki](https://anilist.co/staff/98703/MikiYoshikawa) author of Yankee-kun to Megane-chan.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芝美奈子)

Noted for her character designs on [Black Butler](https://anilist.co/anime/4898/), [Noir](https://anilist.co/anime/272/), [Tegami Bachi](https://anilist.co/anime/6444/) among many others.

__Associated Names:__ Poyoyon Rock (ぽよよんろっく), Poyoyon♥Rock (ぽよよん♥ろっく), Pucchin Purin

[Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/punipoyo)

A Japanese animator, character designer, and animation director currently living in Tokyo, Japan. He often goes by the pseudonym Poyoyon Rock.  He is also a member of the doujinshi circle Pokopii.  

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Associated Names:__ Poyoyon Rock (ぽよよんろっく), Poyoyon♥Rock (ぽよよん♥ろっく), Pucchin Purin

A Japanese animator, character designer, and animation director currently living in Tokyo, Japan. He often goes by the pseudonym Poyoyon Rock.  He is also a member of the doujinshi circle Pokopii.

__Height:__ 153 cm 
__Agency:__ AXL-ONE

[Profile (AXL-ONE)](https://axl-one.com/talent/sato.htmll) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/sato-satomi58) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/satosatomi58) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sugar_me58/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satomi_Satō) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤聡美)

She is a voice actress from Miyagi Prefecture, Japan currently affiliated with AXL-ONE. She is a graduate of Tokyo Announce Gakuin Performing Arts College. She is also known as Sugar (しゅがぁ, Shugā). She announced her marriage with fellow voice actor, [Takuma Terashima](https://anilist.co/staff/95494/), on July 6, 2017. 

Non-anime roles:
- Signal, N102 - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Dorothy - Arknights (VG)
- Corrin (Female) - Fire Emblem (VG)
- Alfin Reise Arnor - Kiseki Series (VG)
- Ennea - Kiseki Series (VG)
- Escoffier - Genshin Impact (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dmpmutation)

**Shinji Ishihira** is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiro_mashima)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQLYbIvGWtClestisnB1_6A)__

Japanese manga artist most known for his manga Groove Adventure Rave, published by Kodansha's Weekly Shonen Magazine, from 1999 to 2005. The series was later adapted into an anime. However, the anime adaption was cancelled before it could complete the series.

In 2003, he collected some of his one-shot titles in two volumes: Mashima-en- Vol.1 & 2. Those stories include, among others, Cocona, "Xmas Hearts" and "Fairy Tail", a sort of prototype for his last work.

In 2006, he began his now finished series, Fairy Tail, serialized in Kodansha's Weekly Shonen Magazine. He also published the manga Monster Hunter Orage.

Hiro Mashima was a notable guest at the 2008 San Diego Comic-Con. He has one daughter.

His artwork and [Oda Eiichiro](https://anilist.co/staff/96881/EiichiroOda)'s are greatly similar, but that is due to both of them being influenced largely by [Toriyama Akira](https://anilist.co/staff/96901/AkiraToriyama)'s work growing up.

His former assistant was [Yoshikawa Miki](https://anilist.co/staff/98703/MikiYoshikawa) author of Yankee-kun to Megane-chan.
